chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Zweiger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew J Zweiger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew J Zweiger was found guilty of Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • Matthew J Zweiger was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.

No devices to access the internet unless approved by Agent.
No Class B establishments.
No contact with females <18 yrs old without approval by Agent with the exception of his daughter.

Comply with sex offender registry.
Absolute sobriety.
AODA evaluation and followthrough.
Mental health assessment.
Sex offender treatment.
Cognative thinking group.
Full time employment (30 hrs/wk) or 10 job searches per month.
Submit DNA sample.
Comply with all child support orders.
If after 3 years of probation, conditions have been met, and Agent feels appropriate, can request termination of remaining 2 years.

timeConds.notes:
Credit for 42 days served.
Effective 01-20-17  defendant may transfer jail sentence to Winnebago County as long as he is monitored on release.

Attorney Ronald Duane Haacke appeared by video means for Defendant Matthew J Zweiger. Prosecuting Atty Scott E. Niemi appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Requesting modification of sentence to allow defendant to serve his jail sentence in Winnebago County because of work.  Full-time work was required.  Judge will accept the transfer to Winnebago County on the condition that he is monitored on release.

DNA proof of submission - obtained.

Defendant Matthew J Zweiger in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Defendant Matthew J Zweiger in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI completed and reviewed by all parties.  Arguments as to penalty made by DA and defense counsel.  Defendant makes a statement.  Voting and firearms restrictions noted.  Court makes a statement.  Ct. 1 - Withhold sentence, 5 years probation with conditions.  Ct. 2 - $150 fine + costs.  Appeal rights.
2nd filing with additional pages
letter from defendant asking to attend funeral - Judge said need $5,000 cash to be posted
Amended - changing Count 1

Plea questionnaire completed.  Amended information filed changing Count 1 to Child Enticement contrary to Sec. 948.07(1).  No contest to amended count 1 and count 2.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty as amended.  Count 3 dismissed.  PSI requested and ordered.
